Package soot.jimple.infoflow.android.axml.flags

Class BitwiseFlagSystem<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • soot.jimple.infoflow.android.axml.flags.BitwiseFlagSystem<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - the keys used to distinguish flags
    public class BitwiseFlagSystem<T>
extends Object
    In some cases, bitmasks might be used in a way where there is a precendence of certain masks to save space. For "normal" bitmasks, the traditional way of checking is much faster. Simple Example: Option A (can be used alone or in combination with others): 01 Option B (cannot be used with option A): 10 Option C (only valid when used with Option A): 11 In this case, we could do checking of B via ((v & 10) == 1) && ((v & 1) != 1) but sometimes there are a lot of options (e.g. inputType)
